posts.title: A bug on production
posts.description: Yesterday when I updated my portfolio a bug appeared in react-router-dom, and this is how i solved it.
body: Yesterday, I created my blog and excitedly deployed it on Vercel. Unfortunately, I encountered a bug: whenever a user clicked on a card to access a post page or reloaded the page after clicking on a post, my website crashed. I initially suspected a bug in the card component, but my attempts to fix it were unsuccessful.

Today, this problem continued to trouble me, with no solution coming to mind. I had already sought help from various developer communities and AI resources, but no one could identify the issue. Since the Vercel 404 page appeared when the error occurred, I consulted the Vercel documentation, but again found no answers. Fortunately, I decided to try explaining my problem to AI again, this time using Microsoft Copilot. Within a minute, it provided me with the code to fix the bug - a Vercel.json configuration for Single-Page Applications (SPAs).

posts.title: This blog history
posts.description: First post telling how I created this blog without a backend.
body: I've always wanted to have a blog on my portfolio to share experiences, code snippets, and more. However, whenever I considered how to implement it, I immediately envisioned a complex setup with a backend, login system, database, and the associated environment. For a portfolio, that seemed like overkill, and I was hesitant to introduce potential vulnerabilities, API concerns, and database hosting issues.

Initially, I contemplated hardcoding the blog, but I recognized that this would be a bad practice and impractical for adding new posts easily. Fortunately, I realized that I could simulate a database using JSON and insert posts directly into it. This is how I built my blog, and you can find the complete source code in the linked repository on my portfolio (link below).
